intro: Cryptanthus leopoldo-horstii, commonly known as the Leopoldo-Horst's candy cane plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Haemodoraceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its striking, tubular red and orange flowers that resemble candy canes. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
